message.content:
cs.DB, cs.IR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper addresses the problem of answering queries over a distributed information system, which suggests that it could belong to the databases (cs.DB) or information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories. The use of a taxonomy to organize the objects indexed by terms further supports the possibility of it belonging to cs.IR. The paper also discusses the implementation of the algorithm in a distributed setting, which could suggest it belongs to the distributed computing (cs.DC) or distributed systems (cs.DS) sub-categories. Finally, the evaluation of the performance of various architectures by simulation on a network with O(10^4) nodes could suggest it belongs to the social and information networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
